text:
We intend to build Apache 2.0.53 with mod_python 3.1.3 (Python 2.3.4) on Sun 
Solars 8.
We could successfully build this mod_python into Apache 2.0.52, but building 
for Apache 2.0.53 failed.

OS: Sun Solaris 8, 
C compiler: gcc 3.4.3
http : Apache 2.0.52 vs Apache 2.0.53
Python: 2.3.4
mod_python: 3.1.3

This is the Apache 2.0.52 environment:
$ /path_to_apache/2.0.52/bin/apxs -q CC
/usr/local/gcc-3.4.3/bin/gcc

$ /path_to_python/bin/python
Python 2.3.4 (#1, Apr 12 2005, 13:25:35)
[GCC 3.4.3] on sunos5
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>>

mod_python 3.1.3 build successful.


For Apache 2.0.53:
$ /path_to_apache/2.0.53/bin/apxs -q CC
/usr/local/gcc-3.4.3/bin/gcc

Python is as above

mod_python configure:

in_mod_python_src$ ./configure --with-apxs=/path_to_apache/2.0.53/bin/apxs --
with-python=/path_to_python/bin/python

make command fails with
/path_to_apache/2.0.53/build/libtool --silent --mode=link /usr/local/gcc-
3.4.3/bin/gcc -o mod_python.la  -rpath /path_to_apache/2.0.53a/modules -module -
avoid-version    hlistobject.lo hlist.lo filterobject.lo connobject.lo 
serverobject.lo util.lo tableobject.lo requestobject.lo _apachemodule.lo 
mod_python.lo -L/path_to_python/lib/python2.3/config -L/usr/local/lib -lm -
lpython2.3 -lresolv -lsocket -lnsl -lrt -ldl -lpthread -lm
Text relocation remains                         referenced
    against symbol                  offset      in file
<unknown>                           
0x3858      /path_to_python/lib/python2.3/config/libpython2.3.a(listobject.o)
...etc.

We have checked configure.in, Makefile.in, configure, Makefile within the 
mod_python 3.1.3 src directory structure for both Apache 2.0.52 and 2.0.53, no 
differencies were found. 
However, we found that the libtool (./build/libtool) is differs for 2.0.53:


... 151312 Jan 24 17:01 /path_to_apache/2.0.52/build/libtool

... 212667 Apr 11 10:43 /path_to_apache/2.0.53/build/libtool

Could somebody please let me know what I am doing wrong???

Best Regards,
Gyula Toke
creator: Gyula.Toke@pfizer.com

text:
You need to build the python library using -fPIC in CFLAGS; please discuss on a
mod_python list or users@httpd.apache.org rather than here, though.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
